content.title: Post Matric Merit Scholarship
content.department: Department of Higher and Technical Education, Government of Mizoram
content.beneficiary: Students from economically weaker sections of society
content.details: The Post Matric Merit Scholarship is a scheme offered by the Government of Mizoram to provide financial assistance to meritorious students belonging to economically weaker sections of the society. The scholarship is aimed at encouraging students to pursue higher education and to reduce the financial burden on their families.
benefits: Maintenance allowance (for boarding and lodging expenses)
Other related expenses like books, stationery, etc.
eligibility: Only the children/wards or bonafide permanent residents of Mizoram prosecuting regular studies in a recognized Post Matric Institution in India shall be eligible for the award of the Scholarships.
No student found guilty of misconduct or breach of discipline shall be eligible for the scholarship.
No student who fails to secure at least 60% marks of first division/class at the last Board or University examination shall be eligible for the Scholarship.
Students who after passing one stage of Post Matric Education are studying in the same stage of Education in a different subject/faculty shall not be eligible.
Students who after completing their Educational career in one professional course of study are pursuing a course in a different professional line of the same level shall not be eligible.
Students pursuing Post-Graduate courses in Medicine will be eligible if they are not allowed to practice during the period of their course.
Candidates who pursue their studies through correspondence Courses shall not be eligible.
A scholar under these rules should not hold any other scholarship or stipend of higher value.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of the Post-Matric Merit Scholarship in Mizoram?
faqs.answer: The Post Matric Merit Scholarship in Mizoram is a scholarship program offered by the Department of Higher and Technical Education, Government of Mizoram. It is designed to provide financial assistance to students from economically weaker sections of society who are studying at the post-secondary level.

faqs.question: What is the amount of the scholarship under the Post Matric Merit Scholarship in Mizoram?
faqs.answer: The amount of the scholarship under the Post Matric Merit Scholarship in Mizoram varies depending on the course and level of study. The scholarship covers the following expenses: Admission fee, Tuition fee, Maintenance allowance, Books and stationery allowance, Other allowances as per the norms of the scholarship scheme.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for the Post Matric Merit Scholarship in Mizoram?
faqs.answer: The eligibility criteria for the Post Matric Merit Scholarship in Mizoram include: The applicant must be a permanent resident of Mizoram, must have passed the last qualifying examination with at least 60% marks, must be enrolled in a post-secondary course in a recognized institution in India, and the annual family income of the applicant must not exceed Rs. 2.50 lakhs.

faqs.question: What are the documents required to apply for the Post Matric Merit Scholarship in Mizoram?
faqs.answer: The documents required to apply for the Post Matric Merit Scholarship in Mizoram include: Mark sheets of the last qualifying examination, Income certificate of the family, Caste certificate (if applicable), Bank passbook details, Aadhaar card.

faqs.question: What is the application process for the Post Matric Merit Scholarship in Mizoram?
faqs.answer: The application process for the Post Matric Merit Scholarship in Mizoram involves the following steps: Visit the official website of the Mizoram Scholarship Board, register on the portal and fill in the required details, upload the necessary documents, and submit the application form online.

faqs.question: What is the selection process for the Post Matric Merit Scholarship in Mizoram?
faqs.answer: The selection process for the Post Matric Merit Scholarship in Mizoram is based on the merit of the applicant. The applicants are shortlisted based on their marks in the previous qualifying examination. The final selection is made by a committee constituted by the Department of Higher and Technical Education, Government of Mizoram.
